bill_title: revise auditing requirements for water development districts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise auditing requirements for certain water-related special purpose districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 46A-3D-4 be amended to read as follows: 46A-3D-4. The fiscal year of the water development district shall coincide with the calendar year. The water development district board at At the close of each year of business in which the district's revenues exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars, the district board shall obtain an audit by the State Department of Legislative Audit, or an auditor approved by the State Department of Legislative Audit, of the books, records, and financial affairs of the water development district. A written report of the audit shall be kept on file in the principal place of business of the water development district and a copy of the report shall be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and with the Board of Water and Natural Resources. Notice of availability of the audit report shall be promptly published in the official newspapers of the water development district. A water development district with revenues that do not exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars may obtain a biennial audit as provided in this section. The biennial audit shall include information from both years. Section 2. That § 46A-6-52 be amended to read as follows: 46A-6-52. At the close of each fiscal year during which any loan agreement is in effect pursuant to § 46A-3D-18 or during which the irrigation district's revenues exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars, the irrigation district shall obtain an audit by the State Department of Legislative Audit, or an auditor approved by the State Department of Legislative Audit, of the books, records, and financial affairs of the irrigation district. A written report of the audit shall be kept on file in the principal place of business of the irrigation district, and copies of the report shall be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and with the Board of Water and Natural Resources. An irrigation district with revenues that do not exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars may obtain a biennial audit as provided in this section. The biennial audit shall include information from both years. Section 3. That § 46A-9-68 be amended to read as follows: 46A-9-68. The fiscal year of the water user district shall coincide with the calendar year. The board of directors, at At the close of each year's business, if the district's revenues for the year exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars, the district shall cause an audit of the books, records, and financial affairs of the district to be made by an experienced public accountant, copies of a written report of which audit, certified to by said auditors, the State Department of Legislative Audit, or an auditor approved by the State Department of Legislative Audit. A written report of the audit shall be placed and kept on file at the principal place of business of the district and shall be filed with the secretary of state and with the Board of Water and Natural Resources. A water user district with revenues that do not exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars may obtain a biennial audit as provided in this section. The biennial audit shall include information from both years. Section 4. That § 46A-14-79.1 be amended to read as follows: 46A-14-79.1. At the close of each fiscal year during which any loan agreement is in effect pursuant to § 46A-3D-18 or during which the watershed district's revenues exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars, the watershed district shall obtain an audit by the State Department of Legislative Audit, or an auditor approved by the State Department of Legislative Audit, of the books, records, and financial affairs of the watershed district. A written report of the audit shall be kept on file in the principal place of business of the watershed district, and copies of the report shall be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and with the Board of Water and Natural Resources. A watershed district with revenues that do not exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars may obtain a biennial audit as provided in this section. The biennial audit shall include information from both years. Section 5. That § 46A-18-71.1 be amended to read as follows: 46A-18-71.1. At the close of each fiscal year during which any loan agreement is in effect pursuant to § 46A-3D-18 or during which the water project district's revenues exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars, the water project district shall obtain an audit by the State Department of Legislative Audit, or an auditor approved by the State Department of Legislative Audit, of the books, records, and financial affairs of the water project district. A written report of the audit shall be kept on file in the principal place of business of the water project district, and copies of the report shall be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and with the Board of Water and Natural Resources. A water project district with revenues that do not exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars may obtain a biennial audit as provided in this section. The biennial audit shall include information from both years.
